verses.verse: And it came <S%G1096><s%> about on one <S%G1520><s%> of the days <S%G2250><s%> while He was teaching <S%G1321><s%> the people <S%G2992><s%> in the temple <S%G2413><s%> and preaching <S%G2097><s%> the gospel, <S%G2097><s%> that the chief <S%G749><s%> priests <S%G749><s%> and the scribes <S%G1122><s%> with the elders <S%G4245><s%> confronted <S%G2186><s%> [Him,]

and they spoke, <S%G3004><s%> saying <S%G3004><s%> to Him, "Tell <S%G3004><s%> us by what <S%G4169><s%> authority <S%G1849><s%> You are doing <S%G4160><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> things, <S%G3778><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> who <S%G5101><s%> is the one who gave <S%G1325><s%> You this <S%G3778><s%> authority <S%G1849><s%>?"
And He answered <S%G611><s%> and said <S%G3004><s%> to them, "I shall also <S%G2532><s%> ask <S%G2065><s%> you a question, <S%G3056><s%> and you tell <S%G3004><s%> Me:
"Was the baptism <S%G908><s%> of John <S%G2491><s%> from heaven <S%G3772><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> from men <S%G444><s%>?"

And they reasoned <S%G4817><s%> among <S%G4314><s%> themselves, <S%G1438><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> "If <S%G1437><s%> we say, <S%G3004><s%> 'From heaven, <S%G3772><s%>' He will say, <S%G3004><s%> 'Why <S%G1223><s%> <S%G5101><s%> did you not believe <S%G4100><s%> him? '

"But if <S%G1437><s%> we say, <S%G3004><s%> 'From men, <S%G444><s%>' all <S%G537><s%> the people <S%G2992><s%> will stone <S%G2642><s%> us to death, <S%G2642><s%> for they are convinced <S%G3982><s%> that John <S%G2491><s%> was a prophet. <S%G4396><s%>"
And they answered <S%G611><s%> that they did not know <S%G3609><s%> where <S%G4159><s%> [it came] from.

And Jesus <S%G2424><s%> said <S%G3004><s%> to them, "Neither <S%G3761><s%> will I tell <S%G3004><s%> you by what <S%G4169><s%> authority <S%G1849><s%> I do <S%G4160><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> things. <S%G3778><s%>"

And He began <S%G757><s%> to tell <S%G3004><s%> the people <S%G2992><s%> this <S%G3778><s%> parable: <S%G3850><s%> "A man <S%G444><s%> planted <S%G5452><s%> a vineyard <S%G290><s%> and rented <S%G1554><s%> it out to vine-growers, and went <S%G589><s%> on a journey <S%G589><s%> for a long <S%G2425><s%> time. <S%G5550><s%>

"And at the [harvest] time <S%G2540><s%> he sent <S%G649><s%> a slave <S%G1401><s%> to the vine-growers, in order <S%G2443><s%> that they might give <S%G1325><s%> him [some] of the produce <S%G2590><s%> of the vineyard; <S%G290><s%> but the vine-growers beat <S%G1194><s%> him and sent <S%G1821><s%> him away <S%G1821><s%> empty-handed.

"And he proceeded <S%G4369><s%> to send <S%G3992><s%> another <S%G2087><s%> slave; <S%G1401><s%> and they beat <S%G1194><s%> him also <S%G2548><s%> and treated <S%G818><s%> him shamefully, <S%G818><s%> and sent <S%G1821><s%> him away <S%G1821><s%> empty-handed.
"And he proceeded <S%G4369><s%> to send <S%G3992><s%> a third; <S%G5154><s%> and this <S%G3778><s%> one <S%G3778><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> they wounded <S%G5135><s%> and cast <S%G1544><s%> out.

"And the owner <S%G2962><s%> of the vineyard <S%G290><s%> said, <S%G3004><s%> 'What <S%G5101><s%> shall I do <S%G4160><s%>? I will send <S%G3992><s%> my beloved <S%G27><s%> son; <S%G5207><s%> perhaps <S%G2481><s%> they will respect <S%G1788><s%> him.'

"But when the vine-growers saw <S%G3708><s%> him, they reasoned <S%G1260><s%> with one <S%G240><s%> another, <S%G240><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> 'This <S%G3778><s%> is the heir; <S%G2818><s%> let us kill <S%G615><s%> him that the inheritance <S%G2817><s%> may be ours. <S%G1473><s%>'

"And they threw <S%G1544><s%> him out of the vineyard <S%G290><s%> and killed <S%G615><s%> him. What, <S%G5101><s%> therefore, <S%G3767><s%> will the owner <S%G2962><s%> of the vineyard <S%G290><s%> do <S%G4160><s%> to them?

"He will come <S%G2064><s%> and destroy <S%G622><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> vine-growers and will give <S%G1325><s%> the vineyard <S%G290><s%> to others. <S%G243><s%>" And when they heard <S%G191><s%> it, they said, <S%G3004><s%> "May it never <S%G3361><s%> be!"

But He looked <S%G1689><s%> at them and said, <S%G3004><s%> " What <S%G5101><s%> then <S%G3767><s%> is this <S%G3778><s%> that is written, <S%G1125><s%> 'The stone <S%G3037><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> the builders <S%G3618><s%> rejected, <S%G593><s%> This <S%G3778><s%> became <S%G1096><s%> the chief <S%G2776><s%> corner <S%G1137><s%> [stone]'?

"Everyone <S%G3956><s%> who falls <S%G4098><s%> on that stone <S%G3037><s%> will be broken <S%G4917><s%> to pieces; <S%G4917><s%> but on whomever <S%G3739><s%> <S%G302><s%> it falls, <S%G4098><s%> it will scatter <S%G3039><s%> him like <S%G3039><s%> dust. <S%G3039><s%>"

And the scribes <S%G1122><s%> and the chief <S%G749><s%> priests <S%G749><s%> tried <S%G2212><s%> to lay <S%G1911><s%> hands <S%G5495><s%> on Him that very <S%G846><s%> hour, <S%G5610><s%> and they feared <S%G5399><s%> the people; <S%G2992><s%> for they understood <S%G1097><s%> that He spoke <S%G3004><s%> this <S%G3778><s%> parable <S%G3850><s%> against <S%G4314><s%> them.

And they watched <S%G3906><s%> Him, and sent <S%G649><s%> spies <S%G1455><s%> who pretended <S%G5271><s%> to be righteous, <S%G1342><s%> in order <S%G2443><s%> that they might catch <S%G1949><s%> Him in some statement, <S%G3056><s%> so <S%G5620><s%> as to deliver <S%G3860><s%> Him up to the rule <S%G746><s%> and the authority <S%G1849><s%> of the governor. <S%G2232><s%>

And they questioned <S%G1905><s%> Him, saying, <S%G3004><s%> "Teacher, <S%G1320><s%> we know <S%G3609><s%> that You speak <S%G3004><s%> and teach <S%G1321><s%> correctly, <S%G3723><s%> and You are not partial <S%G2983><s%> <S%G4383><s%> to any, but teach <S%G1321><s%> the way <S%G3598><s%> of God <S%G2316><s%> in truth. <S%G225><s%>
"Is it lawful <S%G1832><s%> for us to pay <S%G1325><s%> taxes <S%G5411><s%> to Caesar, <S%G2541><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> not?"
But He detected <S%G2657><s%> their trickery <S%G3834><s%> and said <S%G3004><s%> to them,
" Show <S%G1166><s%> Me a denarius. <S%G1220><s%> Whose <S%G5101><s%> likeness <S%G1504><s%> and inscription <S%G1923><s%> does it have <S%G2192><s%>?" And they said, <S%G3004><s%> "Caesar's."
And He said <S%G3004><s%> to them, "Then <S%G5106><s%> render <S%G591><s%> to Caesar <S%G2541><s%> the things that are Caesar's, and to God <S%G2316><s%> the things that are God's."

And they were unable <S%G3756><s%> <S%G2480><s%> to catch <S%G1949><s%> Him in a saying <S%G4487><s%> in the presence <S%G1727><s%> of the people; <S%G2992><s%> and marveling <S%G2296><s%> at His answer, <S%G612><s%> they became <S%G4601><s%> silent. <S%G4601><s%>
Now <S%G1161><s%> there came <S%G4334><s%> to Him some <S%G5100><s%> of the Sadducees <S%G4523><s%> (who say <S%G483><s%> that there is no <S%G3361><s%> resurrection <S%G386><s%>),

and they questioned <S%G1905><s%> Him, saying, <S%G3004><s%> "Teacher, <S%G1320><s%> Moses <S%G3475><s%> wrote <S%G1125><s%> for us that if <S%G1437><s%> a man's brother <S%G80><s%> dies, <S%G599><s%> having <S%G2192><s%> a wife, <S%G1135><s%> and he is childless, <S%G815><s%> his brother <S%G80><s%> should take <S%G2983><s%> the wife <S%G1135><s%> and raise <S%G1817><s%> up offspring <S%G4690><s%> to his brother. <S%G80><s%>
"Now <S%G3767><s%> there were seven <S%G2033><s%> brothers; <S%G80><s%> and the first <S%G4413><s%> took <S%G2983><s%> a wife, <S%G1135><s%> and died <S%G599><s%> childless; <S%G815><s%>
and the second <S%G1208><s%>

and the third <S%G5154><s%> took <S%G2983><s%> her; and in the same <S%G5615><s%> way <S%G5615><s%> all <S%G3588><s%> seven <S%G2033><s%> died, <S%G599><s%> leaving <S%G2641><s%> no <S%G3756><s%> children. <S%G5043><s%>
"Finally <S%G5306><s%> the woman <S%G1135><s%> died <S%G599><s%> also. <S%G2532><s%>

"In the resurrection <S%G386><s%> therefore, <S%G3767><s%> which <S%G5101><s%> one's wife <S%G1135><s%> will she be? For all <S%G3588><s%> seven <S%G2033><s%> had <S%G2192><s%> her as wife. <S%G1135><s%>"
And Jesus <S%G2424><s%> said <S%G3004><s%> to them, "The sons <S%G5207><s%> of this <S%G3778><s%> age <S%G165><s%> marry <S%G1060><s%> and are given <S%G1061><s%> in marriage, <S%G1061><s%>

but those <S%G3588><s%> who are considered <S%G2661><s%> worthy <S%G2661><s%> to attain <S%G5177><s%> to that age <S%G165><s%> and the resurrection <S%G386><s%> from the dead, <S%G3498><s%> neither <S%G3777><s%> marry, <S%G1060><s%> nor <S%G3777><s%> are given <S%G7031><s%> in marriage; <S%G7031><s%>

for neither <S%G3761><s%> can <S%G1410><s%> they die <S%G599><s%> anymore, <S%G2089><s%> for they are like <S%G2465><s%> angels, <S%G2465><s%> and are sons <S%G5207><s%> of God, <S%G2316><s%> being <S%G1510><s%> sons <S%G5207><s%> of the resurrection. <S%G386><s%>

"But that the dead <S%G3498><s%> are raised, <S%G1453><s%> even <S%G2532><s%> Moses <S%G3475><s%> showed, <S%G3377><s%> in the [passage about the burning] bush, <S%G942><s%> where <S%G5613><s%> he calls <S%G3004><s%> the Lord <S%G2962><s%> the God <S%G2316><s%> of Abraham, <S%G11><s%> and the God <S%G2316><s%> of Isaac, <S%G2464><s%> and the God <S%G2316><s%> of Jacob. <S%G2384><s%>
"Now <S%G1161><s%> He is not the God <S%G2316><s%> of the dead, <S%G3498><s%> but of the living; <S%G2198><s%> for all <S%G3956><s%> live <S%G2198><s%> to Him."
And some <S%G5100><s%> of the scribes <S%G1122><s%> answered <S%G611><s%> and said, <S%G3004><s%> "Teacher, <S%G1320><s%> You have spoken <S%G3004><s%> well. <S%G2573><s%>"
For they did not have <S%G5111><s%> courage <S%G5111><s%> to question <S%G1905><s%> Him any <S%G3765><s%> longer <S%G3765><s%> about anything. <S%G3762><s%>
And He said <S%G3004><s%> to them, "How <S%G4459><s%> [is it that] they say <S%G3004><s%> the Christ <S%G5547><s%> is David's son <S%G5207><s%>?

"For David <S%G7035><s%> himself <S%G846><s%> says <S%G3004><s%> in the book <S%G976><s%> of Psalms, <S%G5568><s%> 'The Lord <S%G2962><s%> said <S%G3004><s%> to my Lord, <S%G2962><s%> "Sit <S%G2521><s%> at My right <S%G1188><s%> hand, <S%G1188><s%>
Until <S%G2193><s%> I make <S%G5087><s%> Thine <S%G4771><s%> enemies <S%G2190><s%> a footstool <S%G5286><s%> for Thy feet. <S%G4228><s%>"'
"David <S%G7035><s%> therefore <S%G3767><s%> calls <S%G2564><s%> Him 'Lord, <S%G2962><s%>' and how <S%G4459><s%> is He his son <S%G5207><s%>?"
And while all <S%G3956><s%> the people <S%G2992><s%> were listening, <S%G191><s%> He said <S%G3004><s%> to the disciples, <S%G3101><s%>

"Beware <S%G4337><s%> of the scribes, <S%G1122><s%> who like <S%G2309><s%> to walk <S%G4043><s%> around <S%G4043><s%> in long <S%G4749><s%> robes, <S%G4749><s%> and love <S%G5368><s%> respectful greetings <S%G783><s%> in the market <S%G58><s%> places, <S%G58><s%> and chief <S%G4410><s%> seats <S%G4410><s%> in the synagogues, <S%G4864><s%> and places <S%G4411><s%> of honor <S%G4411><s%> at banquets, <S%G1173><s%>

who <S%G3739><s%> devour <S%G2719><s%> widows' houses, <S%G3614><s%> and for appearance's sake <S%G4392><s%> offer <S%G4336><s%> long <S%G3117><s%> prayers; <S%G4336><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> will receive <S%G2983><s%> greater <S%G4053><s%> condemnation. <S%G2917><s%> "
